Package project3

Class Company

java.lang.Object
project3.Company
public class Company
extends java.lang.Object
The Company class stores a grab bag container of employees and performs payroll operations. The container automatically grows when it is filled. Company methods can add employees, remove employees, set hours, and calculate payments.
Author:
Shane Hoffman, Michael Li

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private Employee[] emplist  
    static int MISS  
    private int numEmployee  
    static int SIZE  

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    Company()
    Creates a Company with an empty array of size 4 to store employees, setting the number of employees to 0.

    Prints out the list of employees in the emplist array in ascending date hired order.

    Prints out the list of employees in the emplist array in alphabetical order by department.

    Helper method for the print functions, print all employees in emplist array.

  • Constructor Details

    • Company

      public Company()
      Creates a Company with an empty array of size 4 to store employees, setting the number of employees to 0.

  • Method Details

    • getEmployees

      public int getEmployees()
      Gets the number of employees added to the emplist array.
      Returns:
      - number of employees that have been added

    • find

      private int find​(Employee employee)
      Searches for a given employee inside the emplist array.
      Parameters:
      employee - - the employee to search for in the emplist array
      Returns:
      index - the index of the employee in the emplist array or -1 if it's a miss

    • grow

      private void grow()
      Helper method to grow the size of the emplist array when it's full.

    • add

      public boolean add​(Employee employee)
      Adds an employee into the emplist array. If it's full then the helper method grow is called.
      Parameters:
      employee - - the employee to add into the emplist array
      Returns:
      true if the employee was successfully added, false otherwise

    • remove

      public boolean remove​(Employee employee)
      Removes an employee from the emplist array. Shifts the array past the index to the left by one position.
      Parameters:
      employee - - the employee to remove from the emplist array
      Returns:
      true if the employee was successfully removed, false otherwise

    • setHours

      public boolean setHours​(Employee employee)
      Sets the working hours for a part time employee.
      Parameters:
      employee - - the employee to set their working hours for
      Returns:
      true if the employees hours were successfully set, false otherwise

    • processPayments

      public void processPayments()
      Calculates the payments for every employee in the emplist array.

    • print

      public java.lang.String print()
      Prints out the list of employees in the emplist array in it's current order.

    • printByDepartment

      public java.lang.String printByDepartment()
      Prints out the list of employees in the emplist array in alphabetical order by department.

    • printByDate

      public java.lang.String printByDate()
      Prints out the list of employees in the emplist array in ascending date hired order.

    • insertionSort

      private void insertionSort​(boolean date)
      Helper method used by the print methods to sort the emplist array. It uses insertion sort and will sort the emplist array by alphabetical department or date hired in ascending order.
      Parameters:
      date - - if true the method sorts by date hired, if false it sorts by alphabetical department

    • exportDatabase

      public int exportDatabase​(java.io.File file)
      Exports the emplist array to a text file passed to the method. Method utilizes the company's printer() method, to convert the emplist to a readable string.
      Parameters:
      file - - file we are exporting to
      Returns:
      1 if database successfully exported, 0 if a place wasn't selected to save to

    • importDatabase

      public int importDatabase​(java.io.File file)
      Imports a text file into the company database. Parses the text file and adds the correct employees to the emplist array.
      Parameters:
      file - - file we are importing from
      Returns:
      1 if database successfully imported, 0 if a file wasn't selected to import from

    • printer

      private java.lang.String printer()
      Helper method for the print functions, print all employees in emplist array.
